特記事項:
この科目は、4/28（木）までの授業をオンデマンドで実施します。履修者確定後、履修者数が教室定員内であれば対面授業となり、教室定員を超えているとオンライン授業となります。なお、対面授業の場合は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”とはなりませんが、オンライン授業の場合は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”となりますので、60単位を超えて卒業に必要な単位として算入することができません（60単位までしか算入できない）。なお、履修者確定後、4/29（金）以降の授業形態を履修者へお知らせします。
The course will be offered on-demand until Thursday, April 28. If the finalized number of registered students is within the capacity of the classroom, the face-to-face class will be offered, and if it exceeds the capacity, the class will be online. The face-to-face course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses, while the online course is subject to the limit and cannot be included as part of the credits required for graduation beyond 60 credits (only up to 60 credits can be counted). After the registered students are confirmed, we will notify the students of the course implementation format from Friday, April 29 onward.
授業方法: Faulty members explains the details of knowledge. Although the main activity for students is to take notes by faulty members and students and within the groups of students.

第1回:
"On-demand"
Theme " Orientation"
The faculty members explain the syllabus of the course, particularly, the course purpose, learning goals and topics.
Question and answer session between the faculty members and students.
Read the syllabus of the course thoroughly to proceed the growth of learning during the semester.
第2回:
"On-demand"
Theme "International Relationships and Diplomacy"
(Lecture)
Question and answer session between the faculty members and students.
Preparation for the individual report based on the lecture.
第3回:
"On-demand"
Theme "Basic Theories of International Relationships"
(Lecture)
Question and answer session between the faculty members and students.
Preparation for the individual report based on the lecture.
第4回:
Theme " The Role of International Organizations "
(Lecture)
Question and answer session between the faculty members and students.
For the lecture of session 2 to 4, prepare the individual reports based on the title given by the faculty members and submit it before the session 7.
第5回:
Theme "What is ASEAN?"
(Lecture)
Question and answer session between the faculty members and students.
Preparation for the individual report based on the lecture.
第6回:
Theme " ASEAN and International/Regional Organization"
(Lecture)
Question and answer session between the faculty members and students.
Preparation for the individual report based on the lecture.
第7回:
Theme "EU and ASEAN Cooperation in Facing Global Issues"
(Lecture)
Question and answer session between the faculty members and students.
For the lecture of session 5 to 7, prepare the individual reports based on the title given by the faculty members and submit it before the session 9.
第9回:
Theme "Japan and ASEAN Relationship"
(Lecture)
Question and answer session between the faculty members and students.
Preparation for the individual report based on the lecture.
第10回:
Theme "ASEAN and China's Raise and Geopolitical Stability"
(Lecture)
Question and answer session between the faculty members and students.
For the lecture of sessions 9 and 10, prepare the individual reports based on the title given by the faculty members and submit it before the session 12.
第11回:
Theme "Understanding International Relations Theory of ASEAN in Asia"
(Lecture)
Question and answer session between the faculty members and students.
Preparation for the individual report based on the lecture.
第12回:
Theme " ASEAN Political-Security Community Challenges"
(Lecture)
Question and answer session between the faculty members and students.
For the lecture of sessions 11 and 12, prepare the individual reports based on the title given by the faculty members and submit it on the session 14.
第13回:
Theme " ASEAN Future and Integration with Asian Countries"
(Lecture)
Question and answer session between the faculty members and students.
Reflect all the sessions from 1 to 14 to check the growth of learning.
第14回:
Theme " Reflection for the Whole Course"
The faculty members summarize the syllabus of the course to check what the student have learned to reflect their growth of learning within the semester.
Question and answer session between the faculty members and students.

評価.参考文献・資料Reference books0: Reference papers will be distributed in class.
評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
各授業科目は、各学部・研究科の定めるディプロマ・ポリシー（DP）・カリキュラム・ポリシー（CP）に基づき、カリキュラム上に配置されています。
DP・CPを意識して本授業科目の学修を進めることで、各学部・研究科の期待する能力が養成されます。
各学部・研究科のDP、CPや教育課程表（授業科目一覧等）は、下記リンクこちらに掲載していますので学修計画の参考にしてください。
